source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘多得布施衣畜，佛欲制諸比丘多畜衣故，語安居比丘：「我欲制諸比丘多畜衣故，
translation: It was then that many of the monks were given clothing and animals, and because the Buddha wanted to restrain the monks from storing much clothing, he said to the monk Anju, I want to restrain the monks from storing much clothing.

source_sentence: 語安居比丘：我欲四月燕坐。
translation: He said to the monk who was staying at Anju, I want to sit in Sāvatthī for four months.

source_sentence: 令諸比丘不得來至我所。
translation: That will prevent the monks from coming to me.

source_sentence: 除一送食比丘及布薩。」
translation: Except for one, he sends food to the monks and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 諸安居比丘受佛教，還眾中，立如是制：若比丘非一送食及布薩至佛所者，
translation: The monks in the monastery accepted the Buddha's teaching and returned to the congregation, establishing a rule like this: If a monk doesn't send food or make offerings to the Buddha without one,

source_sentence: 得波夜提罪。
translation: He'll be guilty of the sin of pāyatti.

source_sentence: 立是制已，白佛，佛默然可之。
translation: After establishing this rule, he said to the Buddha, who quietly approved of it.

source_sentence: 爾時長老優波斯那，與多比丘眾五百人，俱皆阿練兒，著納衣、一食、乞食、空地坐，
translation: It was then that the elder Upāsena and five hundred other bhikṣus, all of whom were arhats, dressed in undergarments, a meal, begging for food, and seated in an open space.

source_sentence: 來去坐臥視瞻進止威儀清淨，持僧伽梨執鉢安庠，從憍薩羅遊行到舍衛國。
translation: He came, went, sat, lay down, and looked around. His manner was pure; he carried his saṃghāṭikāya (monk’s robe), took his bowl, and placed it safely [in the palm of his hands].

source_sentence: 時多比丘祇桓門間經行，長老優波斯那問諸比丘：「佛今所在？」
translation: When many monks were walking through the Jīvaka gate, the elder Uposena asked the monks, Where is the Buddha now?

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「佛在彼東向大房，一板為戶內。
translation: The monks said, “The Buddha is facing east toward the big room to the east. There is a single plank inside the door.

source_sentence: 若欲往者隨意。」
translation: If you want to go there, follow your wishes.

source_sentence: 時長老憂波斯那，往大房所，到已謦欬以指扣戶。
translation: The elder Uposena then went to the large room and closed the door with his fingers.

source_sentence: 佛與開戶，長老優波斯那即入大房舍內到佛所，頭面禮足一面坐。
translation: When the Buddha opened the door with him, the elder Upāsna entered the great dwelling and went to the Buddha, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 佛知故問言：「汝徒眾清淨善好，汝眾何因緣故清淨威儀？」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha asked, You people are pure and good-looking, what are the causes and conditions that make your people pure and dignified?

source_sentence: 答言：「世尊！
translation: He replied, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若比丘來至我所，求讀誦經求依止者，我語是比丘：『汝能盡形作阿練兒，
translation: If a monk comes to me and asks for support by reciting the scriptures, I say to that monk, 'Can you become an arhat in all your forms?

source_sentence: 著糞掃衣、乞食、一食、空地坐，我當教汝讀經與汝依止。』
translation: Putting on your robes, begging for food, a meal, or sitting in an empty place, I will teach you to read the sūtras and give you support.'

source_sentence: 若比丘能行是頭陀法者，我教讀經與依止。
translation: If a monk can practice this as an ascetic, I'll teach him to read the sūtras and rely on them.

source_sentence: 以是故，世尊！
translation: Because of this, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我徒眾威儀清淨。」
translation: My disciples' manner is pure.

source_sentence: 佛問優波斯那：「舊比丘立制，汝知不？」
translation: The Buddha asked Upāsena, Do you know the old monk who established the rule?

source_sentence: 答言：「不知。
translation: He replied, I don't know.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 舊比丘云何立制？」
translation: How did the old monks establish the rules?

source_sentence: 佛語優波斯那：「我欲四月燕坐，語諸比丘：『汝諸比丘不得來至我所，
translation: The Buddha said to Upāsena: I wish to spend the fourth month sitting in meditation.

source_sentence: 除一送食及布薩。』
translation: Except for one, he sends food and the bodhisattva.'

source_sentence: 諸比丘受我語，還眾中立制：若比丘非一送食及布薩往佛所，得波夜提罪。
translation: The monks accepted my words and returned to the congregation, establishing a rule: If a monk doesn't send food or poṣads to the Buddha without one, he'll be guilty of the offense of pāyattika.

source_sentence: 諸比丘立制已來語我，我即默然可之。」
translation: After the monks established the precepts, they said to me, and I quietly approved of them.

source_sentence: 優波斯那言：「世尊！
translation: Upāsena said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 舊比丘知此意不？」
translation: Does the old monk know what this means?

source_sentence: 佛言：「何以不知？」
translation: The Buddha said, Why don't you know?

source_sentence: 佛言：「我從今聽阿練兒著糞掃衣頭陀比丘，若送食、不送食、若布薩、不布薩，
translation: The Buddha said, From now on, I'll listen to the ascetic monk Ālīyatana wearing a robe made of rags and sweeping clothes, if he sends food, doesn't send food, makes offerings, or doesn't make offerings.

source_sentence: 隨意來至我所。」
translation: Come to me as you wish.

source_sentence: 舊比丘聞長老優波斯那非送食、非布薩欲見佛故便到佛所，聞已集比丘僧，
translation: The old bhikṣu had heard that the elder Upāsena, who was neither a messenger of food nor a bodhisattva, wished to see the Buddha and so he came before the Buddha. Having heard this, the bhikṣu gathered the monks together.

source_sentence: 集已喚優波斯那來。
translation: After the assembly, he summoned Upāsna to come.

source_sentence: 眾僧已集，爾時長老優波斯那即到僧中頭面禮上坐足，隨次坐已，舊比丘問優波斯那：「汝知舊比丘立制不？」
translation: When the saṃgha had gathered, the elder Upāsna went to the saṃgha, bowed his head and feet at their feet, and after he sat down in order, the old monk asked Upāsna, Do you know whether the old monk established a rule?

source_sentence: 答言：「不知。」
translation: He replied, I don't know.

source_sentence: 問上坐言：「舊比丘立制云何？」
translation: He asked the superior seat, What's the old monk's established rule?

source_sentence: 答言：「優波斯那！
translation: He replied, Upāsana!

source_sentence: 佛語安居比丘：『我欲四月燕坐，諸比丘不得來至我所，除一送食及布薩。』
translation: The Buddha said to the monks who were staying there, 'I want to sit in meditation for four months, and the monks won't come to me unless I give them food or precepts.'

source_sentence: 我等受佛教，立制：若比丘非一送食、非布薩往佛所者，得波夜提罪。
translation: We accepted the Buddha's teaching and established a rule: If a monk doesn't send food or go to the Buddha without a single offering of food or a bodhisattva, he'll be guilty of the offense of pāyattika.

source_sentence: 佛即默然可之。
translation: The Buddha then remained silent and approved of it.

source_sentence: 汝優波斯那！
translation: You, Upāsana!

source_sentence: 非一送食、非布薩往到佛所，得波夜提罪。
translation: If someone doesn't go to the Buddha with a single offering of food or a non- pusa, they'll be guilty of the offense of pāyattika.

source_sentence: 汝應如法悔過，汝當發露，是罪莫覆藏。」
translation: You should repent of your faults according to the teaching, and you must disclose them; don't hide this sin.

source_sentence: 優波斯那言：「上座知不？
translation: Upāsena said, Does the superior know?

source_sentence: 我到佛所頭面禮足一面坐已，佛知故問我言：『優波斯那！
translation: When I arrived at the Buddha's place, bowed my head and feet to one side and sat down, the Buddha knew why he asked me, saying, 'Upāsena!

source_sentence: 汝徒眾何因緣故威儀清淨？』
translation: What are the reasons why your disciples' manners are so pure?'

source_sentence: 我言：『世尊！
translation: I said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有比丘來至我所，求讀誦經、若求依止，我語是比丘：「汝能盡形作阿練兒，
translation: If there is a bhikṣu who comes to me with the intention of reciting scriptures or relying upon him, I will say to that bhikṣu:

source_sentence: 著糞掃衣、乞食、一食、空地坐，我當教汝讀經與汝依止。」
translation: Put on your robes, beg for food, a meal, or sit in an empty place, and I will teach you to read the sūtras and give them to you as your support.

source_sentence: 若比丘能行是頭陀法者，我教讀經與依止。
translation: If a monk can practice this as an ascetic, I'll teach him to read the sūtras and rely on them.

source_sentence: 以是故，世尊！
translation: Because of this, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我徒眾威儀清淨。』
translation: My disciples' manner is pure.'

source_sentence: 佛問我言：『舊比丘立制，汝知不？』
translation: The Buddha asked me, 'An old monk established a rule, do you know it?'

source_sentence: 答言：『不知。
translation: He replied, 'I don't know.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何立制？』
translation: How can we establish a rule?'

source_sentence: 佛言：『優波斯那！
translation: The Buddha said, 'Upāsena!

source_sentence: 我欲四月燕坐，語諸比丘：「令諸比丘不得來至我所，除一送食及布薩。」
translation: I want to sit in meditation for four months, and I'll tell the monks, So that the monks won't come to me, except for a meal or a precept.

source_sentence: 諸比丘受我語，還眾立制：若比丘非一送食非布薩往佛所者，犯波夜提。
translation: The monks accepted my words and returned to the congregation, establishing a rule: If a monk doesn't send food or go to the Buddha with a single offering that wasn't given by the bodhisattva, it's a violation of pāyattika.

source_sentence: 我即可之。』
translation: I can do it.'

source_sentence: 我言：『世尊！
translation: I said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼舊比丘知此意不？』
translation: Does that old monk know this idea?'

source_sentence: 佛言：『何以不知？』
translation: The Buddha said, 'Why don't you know?'

source_sentence: 佛言：『我從今聽阿練兒著納衣頭陀比丘，若一送食非送食、若布薩非布薩，
translation: The Buddha said, 'From now on, I'll listen to the ascetic monk Ālīyatana who wears a monk's robe. If he sends food or doesn't send food for one meal, or if he gives alms or doesn't give alms,

source_sentence: 隨意來至我所。』」
translation: Come to me as you wish.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘作是念：「我等何不捨居士衣著納衣耶？」
translation: It was then that the monks thought, Why don't we abandon our laymen's robes and put on our undergarments?

source_sentence: 即時諸比丘捨居士衣，皆著糞掃衣。
translation: Immediately, the monks abandoned their laymen's robes and all wore dung sweeping robes.

source_sentence: (三事竟)十誦律卷第五此卷第二十六張第二行，夜提(之下)「乃至三十日皆如上說」者，
translation: (After the Three Practices) Ten Recitations Vinaya, Volume 5 This is the second line of the twenty-sixth fascicle, which says,

source_sentence: 丹本無此中九字，而有「又比丘得不具足衣(乃至)至三十日地了時，
translation: There are no nine words in the Sanskrit here, but there are: Also, when a monk attains an incomplete robe (up to) thirty days after reaching the ground,

source_sentence: 尼薩耆波夜提」等凡九十一行文，國本宋本並無者，今依丹本遆而足之。
translation: The ninety-line texts such as Niṣyagṛpāyattika and so forth, which are all missing from the national and Song texts, are now found in the Dan text.

source_sentence: 同卷二十七張第十三行，即今正本第三十一張第十三行，尼薩耆波夜提(之下)「十二日乃至三十日亦如上說」者，
translation: The thirteenth line in the twenty-seventh section of the same volume, which is the thirteenth line in the thirty-first section of the present main text, and the thirteenth line in the thirteenth section of the nisajipāyattika (below) says, 'Twelve days up to thirty days are likewise explained above.

source_sentence: 丹本無此中十二字，而有「又比丘得不具足衣，停更望得(乃至)至三十日地了時，
translation: There are no twelve syllables in the Sanskrit here, but there are: Furthermore, when a monk obtains an incomplete robe and stops to hope for it (and so on) until he reaches the thirty-day ground,

source_sentence: 尼薩耆波夜提」(等凡)九十二行文，國本宋本並無者，今依丹本遆而足之。
translation: The ninety-two lines of the Niṣāyatti (and so forth) are all missing from the national and Song texts, but now they're sufficient according to the Dan text.

source_sentence: 同卷第二十九張第四行，即今正本第三十七張第四行，尼薩耆波夜提(之下)「十二日乃至三十日皆如上說」者，
translation: The fourth line in the twenty-nineth chapter of the same volume, which is the fourth line in the thirty-seventh chapter of the present main text, says, All twelve days up to thirty days are as explained above.

source_sentence: 丹本無此中十二字，而有「又比丘得不具足衣(乃至)尼薩耆波夜提」(等凡)九十七行文，
translation: The Sanskrit text doesn't have twelve words here, but there are ninety-seven lines that say, Furthermore, a monk who obtains an incomplete robe (and so forth) goes on to become a nun or nun.

source_sentence: 國本宋本所無者，今依丹本遆而足之。
translation: The national and Song texts do not exist, but they are found in the present-day version of the Tang scriptures.
